program_description:
Before we start the experiment we need some information about the participant,
session etc. Please fill in the below form and follow the instructions.
lab_settings_desc:
At the moment you will run the experiment with the language settings below.
They should be the same as the values you have entered in the pre-registration form.
If that is not the case, please change them here.
To run the minimal experiment, please enter 'toy' as the language, 'x' as the country code and city, and 1 as the lab number and year.
language_help: The 2 letter ISO-639-1 language code that you also specified in the pre-registration form.
lab_number_help: The lab number that you also specified in the pre-registration form.
full_language_help: The full language name that you run the experiment in (e.g. English).
country_code_help: The 2 letter ISO-3166-1 country code that you also specified in the pre-registration form.
participant_id_help: Enter the participant ID here. Note that is has to be a number and it cannot be longer than 3 digits.
dummy_mode_help:
If you want to run the experiment in dummy mode, check this box.
In dummy mode, the experiment will run without actually collecting data so you don't need an eye-tracker.
core_session_help:
Please ONLY select this if you want to collect data for the core experiment
with a real participant.
test_session_help:
Please select this if you run a test session
(uses the real experiment but does not mark the participant ID as used).
pilot_session_help: Please select this if you run a pilot session.
danger_zone_desc:
If you need to continue a core session please follow the following procedure:
1. Save a copy the .edf file from the result folder to another location on your PC
but do NOT delete the file in the result folder. Please refer to the experimenter script!
2. Use the same participant ID to restart the session.
continue_core_session_help: If you need to continue a core session after an unexpected crash, check this box.
continue_participant_id_help:
Please select the participant ID that you want to continue the session for.
If the one you are looking for does not appear,
you have to start a new session with a new participant ID.
city_help: Enter the city where the experiment is conducted. This is the same as you have entered in the pre-registration form.
year_help: The preliminary end year of the data collection. This is the same as you have entered in the pre-registration form.
session_id_help: Enter the session ID (1-9). Note that the eye-tracking sessions and psychometric tests sessions use a separate session ID.
error_required_fields: Must fill in all fields in the Required section!
finished_msg: All done! You may now safely close the program.
running_msg:
Please wait while the application performs its tasks. 
This may take a few moments
sure_you_want_to_exit: Are you sure you want to exit?
sure_you_want_to_stop:
Are you sure you want to stop the task? 
Interruption can corrupt your data!
uh_oh:
Uh oh! Looks like there was a problem. 
Copy the text from the status window to let your developer know what went wrong.
validation_failed: One or more fields failed validation.
